previous_statement:
The q-deformed BLM model H_q = {Q_q, Q_q†}, constructed by replacing SU(2) Wigner 3j symbols with U_q(su(2)) quantum 3j symbols in the supercharge, defines a family of N=2 SUSY quantum mechanical models satisfying Q_q² = 0 and H_q = {Q_q, Q_q†} ≥ 0. The construction is valid for two parameter domains: (a) q > 0 real, where the q-3j symbols are real-valued, and (b) q = exp(2πi/r) a primitive root of unity with the admissibility constraint j ≤ (r-2)/2 (equivalently r ≥ 2j+3), where the q-3j symbols are complex but the SUSY algebra persists since {Q,Q†} ≥ 0 holds for any operator Q on a Hilbert space. Without the admissibility constraint, the quantum dimension [2j+1]_q can vanish and Q_q becomes ill-defined. The large-j behavior suggests three distinct geometric regimes of DECREASING EPISTEMIC STATUS:

(I) q = 1 [ESTABLISHED]: The quantum 6j symbols reduce to classical Wigner 6j symbols whose Ponzano-Regge asymptotics govern the large-j behavior. Melonic dominance holds (node 1.2), yielding SYK-like Schwinger-Dyson equations with Euclidean 3D gravity (Ponzano-Regge) interpretation.

(II) Fixed q > 0, q ≠ 1 [CONJECTURAL]: It is CONJECTURED that melonic dominance breaks down due to exponential growth of quantum 6j symbols, with the growth rate governed by hyperbolic tetrahedron volumes. This conjecture is motivated by proven root-of-unity asymptotics (Belletti-Yang 2025) but remains unestablished for fixed real q ≠ 1: the exponential growth itself is an open conjecture (Taylor-Woodward 2005), and the breakdown of melonic dominance depends on additional unproven assumptions about 12j symbol asymptotics (node 1.3).

(III) q = exp(2πi/r), root of unity, j ≤ (r-2)/2 [MIXED STATUS — established mathematics + open connections]: The quantum 6j symbols at root of unity are the algebraic building blocks shared with Turaev-Viro (TV) topological invariants, which describe 3D gravity with cosmological constant Λ = 4π²/r². However, a precise mathematical correspondence between the BLM Feynman diagram expansion and TV/Chern-Simons invariants remains an open problem: the BLM model is NOT a group field theory, and no BLM-to-TV map has been constructed (nodes 1.4.2, 1.4.4). The SUSY structure is preserved for admissible representations j ≤ (r-2)/2 (node 1.4, 1.4.3).

This node synthesizes results from: the SUSY structure (node 1.1), Part I established results (node 1.2), Part II conjectural results (node 1.3), and Part III mixed-status results (node 1.4).
new_statement:
The q-deformed BLM model H_q = {Q_q, Q_q†}, constructed by replacing SU(2) Wigner 3j symbols with U_q(su(2)) quantum 3j symbols in the supercharge, defines a family of N=2 SUSY quantum mechanical models satisfying Q_q² = 0 and H_q = {Q_q, Q_q†} ≥ 0. The construction is valid for two parameter domains: (a) q > 0 real, where the q-3j symbols are real-valued, and (b) q = exp(2πi/r) a primitive root of unity with the admissibility constraint j ≤ (r-2)/3 (equivalently r ≥ 3j+2), where the q-3j symbols are real-valued (since all quantum integers [n]_q for 1 ≤ n ≤ 3j+1 < r are positive real) and the SUSY algebra persists since {Q,Q†} ≥ 0 holds for any operator Q on a Hilbert space. Without the Racah admissibility constraint r ≥ 3j+2, the quantum 3j symbols may be undefined ([3j+1]_q! may contain zero factors) and Q_q becomes ill-defined. The large-j behavior suggests three distinct geometric regimes of DECREASING EPISTEMIC STATUS:

(I) q = 1 [ESTABLISHED]: The quantum 6j symbols reduce to classical Wigner 6j symbols whose Ponzano-Regge asymptotics govern the large-j behavior. Melonic dominance holds (node 1.2), yielding SYK-like Schwinger-Dyson equations with Euclidean 3D gravity (Ponzano-Regge) interpretation.

(II) Fixed q > 0, q ≠ 1 [CONJECTURAL]: It is CONJECTURED that melonic dominance breaks down due to exponential growth of quantum 6j symbols, with the growth rate governed by hyperbolic tetrahedron volumes. This conjecture is motivated by proven root-of-unity asymptotics (Belletti-Yang 2025) but remains unestablished for fixed real q ≠ 1: the exponential growth itself is an open conjecture (Taylor-Woodward 2005), and the breakdown of melonic dominance depends on additional unproven assumptions about 12j symbol asymptotics (node 1.3).

(III) q = exp(2πi/r), root of unity, j ≤ (r-2)/3 [MIXED STATUS — established mathematics + open connections]: The quantum 6j symbols at root of unity are the algebraic building blocks shared with Turaev-Viro (TV) topological invariants, which describe 3D gravity with cosmological constant Λ = 4π²/r². However, a precise mathematical correspondence between the BLM Feynman diagram expansion and TV/Chern-Simons invariants remains an open problem: the BLM model is NOT a group field theory, and no BLM-to-TV map has been constructed (nodes 1.4.2, 1.4.4). The SUSY structure is preserved for admissible representations j ≤ (r-2)/3 (node 1.4, 1.4.3).

This node synthesizes results from: the SUSY structure (node 1.1), Part I established results (node 1.2), Part II conjectural results (node 1.3), and Part III mixed-status results (node 1.4).
